IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
ATTACHMENTS:

     1)  MSP Death Investigation Form 89B

COMPLAINANT:

     1)  Timothy Allan Dixon  W/M  06/03/1965
          11705 Murleys Branch Rd
           Flintstone, MD 21530
           PH# 240-727-9550

VICTIM:

     1)  Keith Wayne Martin  W/M  04/21/1962
          11705 Murleys Branch Rd
          Flintstone, MD 21530

SUSPECT:

     N/A

SCENE PROCESSING:

      Upon my arrival, I observed the victim laying on their back on the floor of a camping trailer. The victim was unclothed and had medical instruments still in place from were EMS had utilized them. Based on my observations and information provided, there was evidence that the victim had an unexpected bowel movement before or while suffering a medical emergency. No obvious signs of trauma were observed on the victim and no obvious signs of foul play or suicide were observed in the camping trailer were the victim was located. I took photographs of the scene and uploaded them to VeriPic.

     Photographs of the victim and additional examination was conducted by Forensic Investigator Joan Mealey-Kruger. The victim was transported to the States Medical Examiner's Office for an autopsy by Forensic Investigator Joan Mealey-Krugar. 

NEIGHBORHOOD CHECK:

     N/A

NARRATIVE:

     On 01/08/2024 at approximately 1239 hrs, I was dispatched to 11705 Murleys Branch Rd, Flintstone, MD for a report of a death investigation. Upon my arrival, I spoke with EMS Personnel. I was advised that they attempted to revive the victim with no success. I was also advised that the victim was pronounced deceased at 1217 hours by Allegany County EMS Paramedic, Ringler. 

     I then spoke with complainant, Timothy Dixon and Deborah Elaine Barnes W/F 11/25/1955 (PH# 301-723-0017). Deborah Barnes stated that on 01/08/2024 at approximately 1034 hours, she responded to a camper trailer on her property to make contact with the victim, Keith Martin. Deborah Barnes/Timothy Dixon advised that Keith Martin resides at their residence, but normally stays in the camper trailer on the property. Deborah Barnes advised that when she made contact with Keith Martin, he was seated on the toilet in the restroom area of the camper trailer. Deborah Barnes advised that Keith Martin was speaking incoherently and she believed something to be wrong. Deborah Barnes then advised Timothy Dixon and instructed him to call 911.

     Deborah Barnes and Timothy Dixon advised that it took EMS approximately 30 minutes to arrive to the residence and during this time Keith Martin became unresponsive. Deborah Barnes and Timothy Dixon advised the upon the arrival of EMS, they removed items such as empty liquor bottles and a chair cushion that Keith Martin had defecated on. Deborah Barnes and Timothy Dixon advised that these items were placed in trash bag and placed outside the camper trailer. Deborah Barnes and Timothy Dixon advised they removed these items to clean up the area inside the trailer to give EMS room to work.   

     Deborah Barnes and Timothy Dixon could not advise of a primary doctor for Keith Martin, but was able to advise that he was seen by doctors at UPMC Western Maryland Hospital. Deborah Barnes and Timothy Dixon also provided at contact for Keith Martin's sister, Kedra Sue Gowans 01/19/67 (PH# 301-707-5253)(kedrasue@gmail.com) and advised that she resides in Florida. Next of kin notification to Kedra Gowans was made by Deborah Barnes. I later spoke with Kedra Gowans on 01/10/2024. Deborah Barnes and Timothy Dixon was able to provide basic medical history information for Keith Martin. 

     Deborah Barnes and Timothy Dixon advised that Keith Martin suffered from alcoholism, had a stroke during covid, high blood pressure and a recent broken femur with surgery. Deborah Barnes and Timothy Dixon advised that after Keith Martin had surgery on his leg, he developed issues with walking and would frequently fall if he was drinking alcohol. Deborah Barnes and Timothy Dixon advised that Keith Martin was prescribed several medications by doctors and was taking a THC style gummy prior to bed to assist in sleeping. Based on information provided by Deborah Barnes and Timothy Dixon, Keith Keith may not have been taking medication as prescribed or taking medications with alcohol. 

      Contact with the States Medical Examiner's Office was made and Forensic Investigator Joan Mealey-Kruger (OCME #2400363) responded to the scene. Joan Mealey-Kruger conducted her investigation and transported the victim to the States Medical Examiner's Office for an autopsy and further investigation. 

      I request this case be CLOSED and any further inquiries be sent to the States Medical Examiner's Office. All events occurred in Allegany County, Maryland. 

CASE CLOSED.
